{"step_by_step_thinking": "Vasoactive amines, such as histamine, are substances that can increase vascular permeability. They are not released by leukocytes, macrophages, or fibroblasts. Mast cells, however, are known for their role in allergy and anaphylaxis, and they release histamine and other vasoactive substances.", "answer_choice": "C. Mast cell"}
